In Julia, You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.

To write a function in Julia that filters a `DataFrame` based on certain criteria and adds a new column with a specific value, you can use the following code:

```julia
using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df::DataFrame)
    # Filter df to only rows where manufacturer is "audi" and model is "a4" or "a4 quattro"
    filtered_df = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro"), df)
    
    # Create a new column with `true` in all rows
    filtered_df[:audi_a4_type] .= true
    
    return filtered_df
end

# Example usage:
df_cars = # Your DataFrame here
resulting_df = audi_filter(df_cars)
```

Make sure to replace `# Your DataFrame here` with the actual `DataFrame` you have in your code. The function `audi_filter` will return a new `DataFrame` that meets the specified criteria.
